title: Pumpfun Plans $4B ICO After $700M Revenue
summary: Pumpfun announced plans for an ICO at $4B FDV, aiming to raise $1B despite already generating $700M in revenue. The announcement on June 3 caused SOL and major Solana memecoins like FARTCOIN to dump, with market participants viewing the raise as excessive.

title: Circle IPO Reaches $66B Market Cap
summary: Circle went public under ticker CRCL at $31, immediately pumping to $100 on listing day and reaching $300 after stablecoin bill passage. The company's fully diluted market cap topped at $66B, exceeding USDC's total supply, while also propelling Coinbase stock to $380.

title: Upbit Listings Create Predictable Trading Pattern
summary: Multiple Upbit listings in June (RVN, AXL, ALT, LPT) showed similar price action: massive pumps on announcement followed by retraces with negative funding. These patterns created consistent shorting opportunities for traders aware of the recurring behavior.

title: Polymarket Twitter Partnership Drives UMA +60%
summary: Polymarket announced a partnership with Twitter on June 6, causing UMA token to surge 60% within two days. The pump was short-lived as the token completely retraced all gains within a week, demonstrating typical news-driven volatility.

title: MASK Pump and Dump: +240% to -50% in Hours
summary: MASK exhibited extreme volatility similar to LAYER and WCT, pumping 240% over a month before crashing 50% in just 3 hours on June 6. ZKJ showed even more extreme behavior with an 85% crash in hours, exemplifying rug-like price action.

title: Robinhood Launches L2 on Arbitrum Orbit
summary: Robinhood announced plans to issue stocks on-chain and launch their own L2 based on Arbitrum Orbit stack on June 30. ARB token pumped 30% the day before on insider trading, then dumped on the actual announcement in classic 'buy rumor sell news' fashion.

title: Rex SOL ETF with Staking Launches
summary: News of Rex SOL ETF with staking starting trading pushed SOL from $150 to $160 on June 30, but gains were entirely retraced within one day. Blockworks reported that SOL ETF approval likely within weeks, adding to institutional adoption narrative.

title: Trump Wallet Controversy and Cease-and-Desist
summary: TRUMP memecoin team announced Trump wallet partnership with Magic Eden on June 3, causing brief 6% pump before Trump sons denied involvement. World Liberty Financial sent cease-and-desist on June 5, leading to site shutdown and eventual cancellation, with TRUMP token continuing to bleed.

title: Bitcoin Summer Chop Around $105k
summary: BTC spent June ranging around $105k with two local bottoms: $100.4k on June 5 during Elon-Trump public dispute, and $98k on June 22 amid Iran-Israel tensions. Trump's ceasefire announcement on June 23 led to sharp recovery to $106k, while altcoins remained weak versus BTC.

title: HYPE Reaches New ATH at $46
summary: HYPE continued its unstoppable price action from April's sub-$10 bottom, breaking $40 resistance on June 10 and reaching new ATH at $46 on June 16. Despite correcting to $30, it closed the month around $40, establishing itself as the cycle's main coin behind SOL.

title: Revenue-Generating DeFi Coins Outperform
summary: SYRUP (Maple Finance) pumped from $100M to $600M market cap as TVL and revenue grew steadily, while EUL (Euler) gained 27% for fifth consecutive green month. LQTY surged 83% and AERO jumped 57% after Coinbase announced Base DEX integration on June 13.

title: KTA Token Crashes 63% from ATH After FUD
summary: Base network's KTA (Keeta), marketed as fast alt L1, continued its 7x May pump into June reaching $1.6B FDV before a FUD tweet caused 30% crash in one hour. The token marked its top and closed June at $0.6, down 63% from ATH.

title: On-Chain Memecoins AURA, USELESS, JOE Surge
summary: Three memecoins dominated June: AURA pumped from $1M to $200M in two days sustaining above $100M, USELESS (on letsbonkfun) went from $5M to $230M with FARTCOIN-like price action, and JOE surged from $15M to $70M maintaining ETH meme relevancy.
